titlestmt.titleproper: Finding Aid for the Walter E. Bennett Photographic Collection LSC.0686
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Tim Holland with assistance from Elizabeth Sheehan in the Center for Primary Research and Training (CFPRT), Spring 2006.

p.date: Online finding aid last updated 2019 October 25.

address.addressline: Room A1713, Charles E. Young Research Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-04-05 15:11:42 -0700.

did.abstract: Walter E. Bennett (1921-1995) was the first salaried photographer for Time, where he worked from 1952 to 1982. The collection consists of photographic materials such as prints, negatives and slides. It also includes miscellaneous manuscripts and ephemera related to Bennett's life and career.
did.physloc: Stored off-site. All requests to access special collections material must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

dao.xlink:title: Walter E. Bennett photographic collection (78 items)

daodesc.p: Walter E. Bennett photographic collection (78 items): 1937-1983 (bulk 1952-1982)

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. All requests to access special collections materials must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use and Reproduction
userestrict.p: Property rights to the physical objects belong to UCLA Library Special Collections. All other rights, including copyright, are retained by the creators and their heirs. It is the responsibility of the researcher to determine who holds the copyright and pursue the copyright owner or his or her heir for permission to publish where The UC Regents do not hold the copyright.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: PORTIONS OF THIS COLLECTION HAVE BEEN DIGITIZED. See the Existence and Location of Copies note for the link to the digitized materials.

altformavail.head: Existence and Location of Copies
altformavail.p: Digitized materials are available electronically at https://digital.library.ucla.edu/catalog/m8f11000zz-89112.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Walter E. Bennett Photographic collection (Collection 686). UCLA Library Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, University of California, Los Angeles.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by Tim Holland with assistance from Elizabeth Sheehan in the Center for Primary Research and Training (CFPRT), Spring 2006.

Collections are processed to a variety of levels depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived user interest and research value, availability of staff and resources, and competing priorities. Library Special Collections provides a standard level of preservation and access for all collections and, when time and resources permit, conducts more intensive processing. These materials have been arranged and described according to national and local standards and best practices.

We are committed to providing ethical, inclusive, and anti-racist description of the materials we steward, and to remediating existing description of our materials that contains language that may be offensive or cause harm. We invite you to submit feedback about how our collections are described, and how they could be described more accurately, by filling out the form located on our website: Report Potentially Offensive Description in Library Special Collections.

arrangement.head: Organization and Arrangement
arrangement.p:
Arranged in the following series:
Miscellaneous, 1937-1982
Prints, 1955-1984
Slides, 1952-1981
Loose negatives, 1953-1982
Batched negatives, 1953-1967

bioghist.head: Biography/History
bioghist.p: Walter Edward Bennett was born on August 16, 1921 in the London suburb of Hornsey, England. He attended John C. Fremont High School in Los Angeles, where he was first exposed to photography through a vocational training class. On November 11, 1942 Bennett joined the Army as a camera man and photo lab tech. He was honorably discharged on January 3, 1946 from the 18th Reinforcement Battalion. Upon returning to Los Angeles, Bennett became a life guard at Hermosa Beach. In 1952, Bennett was hired by Time and became the first-ever salaried photographer at the magazine. For the next 30 years, Bennett worked primarily in Washington D.C. where he photographed presidents, politicians, foreign dignitaries, events, and notable personalities. During this time, Bennett was sent on numerous assignments to photograph presidents during visits of state. Bennett's proximity and longevity in the press arena of Washington D.C. led to his befriending a number of politicians, such as Lyndon B. Johnson, Hubert Humphrey and members of the Kennedy family. Bennett retired in 1982 and died on April 29, 1995.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of photographic materials such as prints, negatives and slides taken by Walter E. Bennett. It also includes miscellaneous manuscripts and ephemera related to Bennett's life and career, such as scrapbooks, clippings, and letters. Bennett's photography documents public figures in Washington D.C., from Presidents Eisenhower through Reagan. The images include portraits of notable politicians and celebrities, shots of anti-Vietnam and Civil Rights protests and marches, foreign travels and campaign trails of presidents, political party conventions, and The Beatles' 1964 and 1966 Washington D.C. concerts and press conferences. Many of the images are unpublished.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This series consists of miscellaneous items related to the life and career of Walter E. Bennett. Materials include a scrapbook that highlights Bennett's accomplishments and career, clippings, letters, and other assorted materials. Materials are arranged in chronological order.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Picture book comprised of clippings, photographic prints, and letters related to the life and career of Walter Bennett.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Letters from unidentified Vice President and Rep. Carl Vinson (Georgia) to Bennett.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Clippings include some of Bennett's published photos in Time Magazine, industry newsletters, and newspaper clippings (see Box 2 for oversize materials).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This series consists of negatives by Walter E. Bennett that were organized and batched at Time into subject-specific envelopes. Negatives include: Presidents Truman through Reagan, various politicians, and foreign dignitaries. The original envelopes and subject labels were retained during processing. Folder descriptions were transcribed from original envelopes. Arranged in alphabetical order by subject.
